body.p: The following new features may require you to upgrade your projects:

ul.li: The new DMN editor supporting DMN 1.5

body.p: To upgrade BAMOE from 9.0.x to 9.1.1, follow these steps:

ul.li: Update pom files from your projects with 9.1.1 BAMOE BOM
Rebuild projects and re-deploy as regular software rollout.

body.p: The new containers are the drop-in replacements for the existing. You can use blue/green deployment strategies

For the new DMN editor: After upgrade, the New DMN Editor will be opened automatically when you first access it in Canvas or Developer tools for VS Code. Existing DMN files (any version) can be opened directly in the editor. For more information, see Authoring decisions

section.title: Maven libraries mapping guide
section.p: With the transition of the KIE projets to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF), it has become necessary to rename a number of Maven modules. The following table(s) describe the changes to the Maven GAV (GroupID/ArtifactID/Version) that happened in 9.1.0:

ul.li: Drools Maven mappings for anything related to rules or decisions.
jBPM Maven mappings for anything related to BPMN-based stateless/stateful processes.
Kogito Maven mappings for anything related to infrastructure or extended services.
KIE Maven mappings for anything else that does not fall into the above categories.
